about.name: Cannes
about.info_text: Cannes is a glamorous city located on the French Riviera, famous for its stunning Mediterranean coastline, luxury hotels, and world-renowned film festival. With its beautiful sandy beaches, upscale boutiques, and vibrant nightlife, Cannes is a playground for the rich and famous. Visitors can enjoy the charming old town, Le Suquet, explore the historic architecture, and savor delicious French cuisine in the city's many restaurants. Whether you're here for the film festival or to soak up the sun, Cannes offers a taste of the good life on the French Riviera.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 73,000
Region: Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur
Time Zone: Central European Time (CET, UTC+1:00)
Language: French
Currency: Euro (EUR)
about.climate_text: Cannes enjoys a Mediterranean climate with mild, wet winters and warm, dry summers. It's an ideal destination for sun-seekers with an abundance of sunny days throughout the year.

attractions_card.title: La Croisette
attractions_card.description: La Croisette is Cannes' famous waterfront promenade, lined with palm trees, luxury hotels, and sandy beaches. It's the perfect place for a leisurely stroll or people-watching.

attractions_card.alt: Palais des Festivals et des Congrès
attractions_card.title: Palais des Festivals et des Congrès
attractions_card.description: The Palais des Festivals is where the Cannes Film Festival takes place each year. Visitors can walk the iconic red carpet and explore this cultural landmark.

attractions_card.title: Le Suquet
attractions_card.description: Le Suquet is the historic district of Cannes, known for its charming streets, quaint restaurants, and the Tour du Masque, a medieval tower offering panoramic views.

attractions_card.title: Île Sainte-Marguerite
attractions_card.description: This island, located just off the coast of Cannes, is known for its natural beauty and the historic Fort Royal, where the Man in the Iron Mask was imprisoned.

attractions_card.title: Eglise Notre-Dame d'Espérance
attractions_card.description: This beautiful church in Le Suquet is a historical gem with stunning architecture and panoramic views from its bell tower.

attractions_card.title: Musée de la Castre
attractions_card.description: Musée de la Castre is a museum located in a medieval castle, featuring art, artifacts, and a lovely garden overlooking Cannes.

food_card.title: Bouillabaisse
food_card.description: Bouillabaisse is a traditional Provençal fish stew, rich in flavors and typically served with a side of rouille sauce and crusty bread.

food_card.title: Ratatouille
food_card.description: Ratatouille is a classic Provençal dish made with a mix of vegetables like tomatoes, eggplant, and zucchini, cooked to perfection.

food_card.title: Crêpes
food_card.description: Crêpes, both savory and sweet, are popular in Cannes. Enjoy a crêpe filled with your choice of ingredients, or indulge in a dessert crêpe with Nutella and bananas.

food_card.title: Côte de Boeuf
food_card.description: Côte de Boeuf is a rib steak served as a hearty and delicious French meal, often accompanied by a selection of sauces and sides.

food_card.title: French Wine
food_card.description: France is renowned for its wine, and Cannes offers a wide selection of French wines to complement your dining experience.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Barrière Le Majestic
hotels_card.description: Hotel Barrière Le Majestic is a luxurious beachfront hotel offering opulent rooms, a private beach, and world-class dining.

hotels_card.title: InterContinental Carlton Cannes
hotels_card.description: The InterContinental Carlton is an iconic hotel on La Croisette, known for its Belle Époque style and stunning views of the Mediterranean.

hotels_card.title: Hôtel Martinez
hotels_card.description: Hôtel Martinez is a historic Art Deco hotel with a prime location on the seafront, offering elegance and top-notch amenities.

hotels_card.title: Five Seas Hotel Cannes
hotels_card.description: The Five Seas Hotel offers contemporary design, a rooftop pool, and a central location in the heart of Cannes.

hotels_card.title: Radisson Blu 1835 Hotel & Thalasso
hotels_card.description: This waterfront hotel features a thalassotherapy spa, comfortable rooms, and beautiful views of the Mediterranean Sea.

transport_card.title: Nice Côte d'Azur Airport
transport_card.description: Nice Côte d'Azur Airport (NCE) is the nearest major airport, providing international and domestic flights for travelers heading to Cannes.

transport_card.title: Cannes Train Station
transport_card.description: Cannes Train Station connects the city to other French cities, including Paris, making it a convenient mode of transportation for travelers.

transport_card.title: Public Transportation
transport_card.description: Cannes has a local bus system, making it easy to navigate the city and explore its various neighborhoods.

transport_card.title: Taxis and Ride-Sharing
transport_card.description: Taxis and ride-sharing services are readily available in Cannes, offering a convenient way to get around the city.
